decks.notes: This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggression and quick damage output by utilizing cards that allow for direct damage to opponents and efficient creature removal. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with support cards such as Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Showdown of the Skalds helps to boost the deck's overall power level and provide additional win conditions. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and secure victories before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to control the game tempo. The creatures, such as Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk, provide a fast clock for the opponent to deal with. By utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, the deck can generate additional value and maintain board presence. The strategy is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

This deck is focused on a fast and aggressive playstyle, combining powerful creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Overlord of the Balemurk with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes cards that provide additional value and control elements such as Ephemerate and Relic of Progenitus. The goal is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control through the high mana resources provided by the UrzaTron lands, using powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers like Karn and Ugin to dominate the board. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and All Is Dust, while also providing a win condition with lethal Eldrazi creatures and Ugin's Labyrinth. The deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent by leveraging its superior mana resources and threats.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive enchantments to control the board and outpace the opponent. By quickly deploying threats like Starfield Shepherd and Witch Enchanter, while also using cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to protect them, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Cards like Quantum Riddler and Prismatic Ending help to remove key threats from the opponent's side of the battlefield, while Ephemerate and Solitude provide extra value by reusing powerful enter-the-battlefield effects.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's hand and board, combined with efficient creatures like Solitude and Flickerwisp to control the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones provides additional threats that can close out the game. The deck also includes cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies and Ephemerate to protect key creatures.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. By combining creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler with instant damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of attacks. The inclusion of cards like Violent Urge and Mutagenic Growth allows for additional burst damage, while cards like Expressive Iteration and Preordain help to maintain card advantage and ensure a consistent stream of threats. The deck's mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, allowing for maximum aggression from start to finish.

This Modern 1 vs 1 Control deck focuses on ramping up quickly with the UrzaTron lands to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide control and removal, while cards like Expedition Map and Sowing Mycospawn help to search for key pieces. The deck also includes ways to handle threats with Kozilek's Command, All Is Dust, Dismember, and Warping Wail, providing a versatile and powerful strategy that aims to out-value opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board using powerful Eldrazi creatures and support cards while utilizing the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana production. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator, while also applying pressure with creatures like Devourer of Destiny. The inclusion of Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and other colorless spells allows for versatile removal options and the potential to quickly close out the game. Ultimately, this deck focuses on resource management and strategic gameplay to outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo, using cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to find key pieces like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also includes protection with Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer, along with ramp cards like Disciple of Freyalise and Generous Ent. The goal is to quickly generate a massive board presence and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Slickshot Show-Off, along with efficient removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, it can apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game. The deck also includes cantrips like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble to dig for threats and answers while maintaining a low mana curve. With a focus on fast-paced gameplay and efficient card selection, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a high-speed aggressive strategy.

Dimir Control focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Thoughtseize and Counterspell to control the board and protect its win conditions, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and Sheoldred's Edict for removal. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and drawing into its key cards.

This deck revolves around using a combination of instant spells like Ephemerate, Faithful Mending, and Goryo's Vengeance to quickly reanimate powerful creatures such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand. The goal is to disrupt your opponent with counter spells like Force of Negation and removal spells like Prismatic Ending, while maintaining control of the board with cards like Solitude and Teferi, Time Raveler. By quickly putting powerful threats onto the battlefield, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on a combination of card advantage, disruption, and controlling the opponent's board through counterspells, removal, and bounce effects. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by consistently drawing cards with Tamiyo and Meticulous Archive, while using Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog to disrupt their game plan. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, as well as hand disruption tools like Thoughtseize, the deck seeks to control the game until it can win with its threats like Kaito and Strategic Betrayal.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Colossus Hammer and Sigarda's Aid with Puresteel Paladin to equip a creature with a massive power boost, often enabling a one-shot kill with Inkmoth Nexus. The deck focuses on efficient mana generation and protection while using Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts. The inclusion of cards like Spell Pierce and Esper Sentinel helps to disrupt opponents' game plans while maintaining card advantage. The deck aims to be fast and explosive, overwhelming opponents before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing a mix of red, green, and white mana sources to cast powerful creatures like Scion of Draco, Territorial Kavu, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames provide direct damage to opponents, while Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact help control the board. Stubborn Denial and Spectral Denial offer protection against opposing spells, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can provide extra card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and burn spells.
